tatami.pc.util.windowLayout

Class LayoutIndications

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.pc.util.windowLayout.LayoutIndications

  • public class LayoutIndications
extends java.lang.Object
    Should be used to indicate to WindowLayout the preferences and restrictions regarding the desired layout of the windows. Should be able to specify relative sizes of different types and instances of windows, avoiding bars at edges of the screen(s), order of the windows in the layout.

    Indication functions return the indication itself so one can use chained calls (e.g. indicateCellsX(cellsX).indicateCellsY(cellsY); )

    Currently supports: indicating relative sizes of windows (by means of total and specific numbers of x and y cells); avoiding bars on the left of the main screen;

    Author:
    olarua

      • indicateReservation

        public LayoutIndications indicateReservation(java.lang.String type,
                                    java.lang.String reserveName,
                                    int positionX,
                                    int positionY)
        Makes a reservation for a window. The reserved space will have a size according to the type of the window. The reservation will be activate when an allocation will be requested with this type and name.

        The indications for the window type should have been done before, otherwise an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        type - - the type of the window
        reserveName - - the name of the window for which the space is reserved
        positionX - - position of the space, in cells, x component.
        positionY - - position of the space, in cells, y component.
        Returns:
        the updated instance itself, for chained calls

      • indicateBar

        public LayoutIndications indicateBar(LayoutIndications.BarPosition pos,
                            int width,
                            int screen)
        Parameters:
        pos - position of the bar to avoid
        width - width of the bar
        screen - the index of the screen on which the bar exists
        Returns:
        the updated instance itself, for chained calls
